p: Total Chikungunya virus antibodies detected was 27.69%. Of this 20.69% were positive for only IgG antibodies. The IgG frequency was higher in males 21.4% (18/84) than in females 20.69% (36/176) though there was no association between gender and IgG seropositivity. Whiles sero-prevalence was higher in the 21–40-year age group (31/54), the age groups within the bracket of ≤ 5 and ≥ 51 years were not found to be positive for anti-Chikungunya IgG antibodies and no association between age and IgG seropositivity ( p = 0.096) was established.
